publishedBibles.derived: From the original Hebrew, Aramaic, and Greek

translations.name: The Inclusive Bible
translations.description: The Inclusive Bible is an inclusive-language translation of the Old and New Testaments published in 2007. It replaces gender specific language with gender-neutral language. Not merely content to replace male pronouns, the translators reworked passages that can be construed as pertaining to men only. For example, “gird up your loins” has been replaced with “tighten your belt.”

translations.name: The Inclusive Bible
translations.description: The Inclusive Bible is an inclusive-language translation of the Old and New Testaments published in 2007. It replaces gender specific language with gender-neutral language. Not merely content to replace male pronouns, the translators reworked passages that can be construed as pertaining to men only. translations.name: Third Millennium Bible
translations.description: The Third Millennium Bible is an update to the Authorized 1611 KJV. While using more modern language than the Authorized Version, it attempts to preserve the 1611’s Jacobean language. The Third Millennium Bible comprises all the books contained in the KJV including the Old Testament, the New Testament, and the Deuterocanonical Books.

translations.name: Deuel Enterprises Inc.
translations.description_short: Deuel Enterprise Inc. is a bible publisher.  They publish updated versions of the King James Bible. This company is international and  ships bibles all over the world
